contentList.content: A ring that hums with limitless potential.
Contains combat and buff related spells.
Cheat: Dice Roll Positive Bonus Toggle
Adds a +20 to all Dice Rolls.
Adds +100 to Dice Rolls. You can still roll Critical Failures.
Surrounded by silver mist, you teleport to an unoccupied space.

Turn creatures <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GREATER_INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag>. Attacks against them have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>. They attack with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.
Bestow the ability to <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_Fly">Fly</LSTag> upon you and your allies.
Summons 2500 gold. What else can I say? It's free money.
Call upon your deity in your moment of greatest need.
Summons Smokepowder Barrels at the target location.
Summons Water Barrels at the target location.
Summons Oil Barrels at the target location.
Summons Firewine Barrels at the target location.
Summons Runepowder Barrels at the target location. You are responsible for what happens if you use this.
Touch a creature - it can see <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag> creatures and pierce the planes with its eyes.
Summons Acid Barrels at the target location.
Surrounded by silver mist, you teleport to an unoccupied space.
Become able to see <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> creatures, and possibly reveal them to others.
Sets all Ability Scores to 25. Has no effect if your Ability Scores are already greater than 25.
Unlock objects that are held shut by a mundane locks.
Shoot [2] magical darts, each dealing [1]. They always hit their target.
Shoot a bright flame from your fingers that explodes upon contact, torching everything in the vicinity.
Summons Brine Barrels at the target location.
Summons Nautiloid Tanks at the target location.
Summons 2500 gold. What else can I say? It's free money.
The flesh-like lid of this rubbery container seems to quiver when touched.
The flesh-like lid of this rubbery container seems to quiver when touched.

Summon the Tutorial Chest.
This chest is often used by mod authors to give the player access to modded items.
Chest will be destroyed after 5 rounds. Enable Turn-Based Mode and grab what you need.
Summons 10000 gold. What else can I say? It's free money.
You must wait before summoning the Tutorial Chest again.
A secret concoction of smokepowder and gnomic mysticism, a single vial of runepowder is more volatile than a whole barrel of smokepowder. Who knows what this much could do...
Made of precious stone and covered in gold, this chest is both sturdy and pleasing to the eye.
Summon a chest which contains every Dye and Dye Remover. These Dyes are not consumed on use.
Summons a bag filled with Camp Supplies.
Summon a chest which contains every Dye and Dye Remover. These Dyes are not consumed on use.
A bag full of delicious hag scalp chunks. Ethically sourced from the finest free range hags.
A collection of Auntie Ethel's finest brews. Drink up, Petal.

Summons a chest with most Potions, Poisons, Elixers and a few extra goodies.
Chest will be destroyed after 5 rounds. Enable Turn-Based Mode and grab what you need.
You must wait before summoning the Potion Box again.

Summons a chest with most Magic Scrolls.
Chest will be destroyed after 5 rounds. Enable Turn-Based Mode and grab what you need.
You must wait before summoning the Scroll Box again.
Become able to see <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag> creatures and pierce the planes with your eyes.
Can see <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> creatures within [1].
Can see <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> creatures within [1].

Turn creatures <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GREATER_INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag>. Attacks against them have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>. They attack with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.

Turn yourself and nearby allies <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GREATER_INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag>. Attacks against those affected by the spell have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>. Those affected by the spell attack with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.
Entity has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>. Attack Rolls against it have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
Bestow the ability to <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_Fly">Fly</LSTag> to you and nearby allies.
Turn a <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PETRIFIED">Petrified</LSTag> creature back to its organic form.
Atrophy a foe, temporarily turning them to stone.
Channel the power of money and swag to turn the target into gold temporarily.

Summons a chest with most Arrows.
Chest will be destroyed after 5 rounds. Enable Turn-Based Mode and grab what you need.

Summons a chest with most Grenades.
Chest will be destroyed after 5 rounds. Enable Turn-Based Mode and grab what you need.

Summons a chest with most Quality Armor.
Chest will be destroyed after 5 rounds. Enable Turn-Based Mode and grab what you need.
You must wait before summoning the Grenade Box again.
You must wait before summoning the Arrow Box again.
You must wait before summoning the Equipment Box again.
This exquisitely-crafted chest, ornamented with gems and lined with cushioned velvet, is fit for storing the finest treasures.
This exquisitely-crafted chest, ornamented with gems and lined with cushioned velvet, is fit for storing the finest treasures.
A chest suitable for lashing to carts and wagons.
This exquisitely-crafted chest, ornamented with gems and lined with cushioned velvet, is fit for storing the finest treasures.

Become immune to all Damage and Status Effects.
You will be given a choice of which version of God Mode you want when you activate this passive.
This exquisitely-crafted chest, ornamented with gems and lined with cushioned velvet, is fit for storing the finest treasures.

Summons a chest with most Quality Weapons.
Chest will be destroyed after 5 rounds. Enable Turn-Based Mode and grab what you need.
You must wait before summoning the Armor Box again.
You must wait before summoning the Weapon Box again.
Though this chest's design is elaborate, the wood is unfinished, as though its maker lost interest partway through.

Summons a chest with most Quality Jewelry.
Chest will be destroyed after 5 rounds. Enable Turn-Based Mode and grab what you need.
You must wait before summoning the Jewelry Box again.
This exquisitely-crafted chest, ornamented with gems and lined with cushioned velvet, is fit for storing the finest treasures.
A secret concoction of smokepowder and gnomic mysticism, a single vial of runepowder is more volatile than a whole barrel of smokepowder. Who knows what this much could do...
Like a phoenix, you rise from the ashes.

Never Critical Fail on Ability Checks, Skill Checks, Saving Throws and Attack Rolls.

May not work 100% of the time. Nothing I can do about this. Disabling Karmic Dice in Options -> Gameplay may give more consistent results.

Always Critical Roll on Ability Checks, Skill Checks, and Saving Throws.
May not work 100% of the time. Nothing I can do about this. Disabling Karmic DIce in Options -> Gameplay may give more consistent results.

Never Critical Fail on Ability Checks, Skill Checks, and Saving Throws.
May not work 100% of the time. Nothing I can do about this. Disabling Karmic DIce in Options -> Gameplay may give more consistent results.
Immune to all Damage and Status Effects. This includes positive Status Effects like Invisibility, Flight, etc.
Set all Ability Scores to 30. Has no effect if your Ability Scores are already greater than 30.
Adds a +20 to all Dice Rolls.

Always Critical Roll on Ability Checks, Skill Checks, Saving Throws and Attack Rolls.

May not work 100% of the time. Nothing I can do about this. Disabling Karmic Dice in Options -> Gameplay may give more consistent results.
Shoot a bright flame from your fingers that explodes upon contact, torching everything in the vicinity.
Restores all nearby allies as if they had finished a Long Rest and removes all negative effects.
Gain the ability to comprehend and communicate with beasts.
Grant a semblance of life to a humanoid corpse, allowing it to answer up to 5 questions.

Skeletons and creatures killed with Acid, Fire, Lightning, Necrotic, or Radiant damage no longer have a mouth and can't be made to talk using this spell.

Doesn't work on Undead.
Summons a Runepowder Barrel at the target location. You are responsible for what happens if you use this.
Call forth rain. It extinguishes exposed flames and forms a water surface.
Cause water-based surfaces (such as water, steam, ice, blood, and poison) to vanish.
Call forth rain or destroy a water-based surface.
Cheat: Saving Throws Always Critical Success
Saving Throws always roll as a Critical Success.
Cheat: Skill Checks Always Critical Success
Skill Checks always roll as a Critical Success.
Cheat: Ability Checks Always Critical Success
Ability Checks always roll as a Critical Success.
Cheat: Ability Checks Never Critical Fail
Ability Checks never roll as a Critical Failure.
Cheat: Skill Checks Never Critical Fail
Skill Checks never roll as a Critical Failure.
Cheat: Saving Throws Never Critical Fail
Saving Throws never roll as a Critical Failure.
Shoot [3] shards of ice that deals [1]. It explodes and deals [2] to anyone nearby. It leaves an ice surface. They always hit their target.
This spell can be cast while you are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">Silenced</LSTag>.
Cleans the caster and nearby party members as if they had used soap.

Summons a chest with a collection of miscellaneous items that did not fit with one of the other chests.
Chest will be destroyed after 5 rounds. Enable Turn-Based Mode and grab what you need.
You must wait before summoning the Tool Box again.
A common chest of timber and iron.

The Lord of Murder wasn't always a lord. He was once just a petty killer. When Bhaal first drew blood in a Baldurian back-alley, it dropped to the ground and lingered. When he ascended, this dried blood-drop grew, warped - and became sharp.

While you have this effect, you do not need to have the Cheaters Ring equipped to have access to the spells and passives from the ring.
Toggle the Cheat: Ring Abilities passive in the passives tab on the Hotbar/Wheel menu to remove this effect.

Allows the target to use all of the Cheaters Ring abilities without having the ring equipped.
Toggle the Cheat: Ring Abilities passive in the passives tab on the Hotbar/Wheel menu to remove this effect.

Toggle this on to remove the effects of the Cheaters: Unlock Passives spell.
This will remove the abilitiy to use the passives from Cheaters Spell Scroll
You must wait before summoning more gold.
While this is toggled on, all nearby party members will be automatically washed as if they had used soap at the end of combat.
Hanging suspended in murky slime, the living tadpole looks like some hideous cousin to the slug, only gorged and slick with remnants of brain fluid.
The target gains a +20 bonus to all Dice Rolls.
Gains a +20 to all Dice Rolls.
Bag of Mind Flayer Parasite Specimens
Cheaters Summon Mind Flayer Parasite Bag

Summon a bag full of Mind Flayer Parasite Specimens.
If the bag is empty, check your Illithid Power menu.
A bag filled with all Alchemy Ingredients.
Summons a bag with most Alchemy Ingredients.
Heavy steel bones and teeth enclose the armour's chest and neck like a grotesque exoskeleton that both swallows and protects the wearer.

A tyrant's grip must be one of cool, unforgiving, and intricately realised steel. It cannot budge, cannot falter, no matter the pressure, and its fingertips must deeply pierce those who would struggle against it.
Silver Sword of the Astral Plane

The fervour with which the githyanki express devotion to their queen is admirable to some, disquieting to others. When confronted with the fallibility of the divine (since no one is wholly perfect), who knows what reaction such folk might evince.

The Lord of Murder wasn't always a lord. He was once just a petty killer. When Bhaal first drew blood in a Baldurian back-alley, it dropped to the ground and lingered. When he ascended, this dried blood-drop grew, warped - and became sharp.
Every contract a devil makes has some form of insurance - this one is cast in infernal iron and was forged in deep, ruinous hellfire.
Each framed facet of the lantern glass is pierced by lances and long tendrils of eerily beautiful moonlight.
Encased in a cocoon of shadow within the lantern, the mangled pixie lies like some deformed pupa, its mouth slack, and those same shadows crawling over its greying tongue.
Hard, fleshy leather has been derived from a countless slew of victims to form this armour for Bhaal's fetid chosen.

The large chunk of amber set into the handle of this luminous mace supposedly holds four drops of godly blood, fallen to the earth in a battle between an avatar of Lathander and a maddened Chosen of Mystra.
This exquisitely-crafted chest, ornamented with gems and lined with cushioned velvet, is fit for storing the finest treasures.

Summons a chest with most Camp Clothes.
Chest will be destroyed after 5 rounds. Enable Turn-Based Mode and grab what you need.
You must wait before summoning the Clothing Box again.

This spell should only be used if updating from a version of the mod older than 3.2 and you are encountering issues with certain spels not working. You do not need to cast this if you start a new game. This spell is only useful for those updating the mod on an existing save and should fix newly added spells not working or summoning their respective chest.
This spell is a temporary solution and will be removed in a future version as it will be done automatically when you load a save.
Please do not do anything while you have this status on a character. When it disappear you are free to continue playing like normal.

Shar's aspect winds its way through the patterns and pauldrons of this half plate, and any light cast nearby seems to almost quiver away from it, afraid. For even the light knows that the clank of this armour is swiftly followed by a Dark Justiciar's silent blade.
Though caked with mud and grime, the ring smells faintly of lavender. Remarkable, considering where it's been.
A bag with most of the Epilogue Clothing. Some of these may not work with every body type. I will not be fixing them.
Restores Actions, Bonus Actions, and Movement.

Increase Action Points and Bonus Action Points points by 3 as well as increase Movement Speed by 30m.
Restores all Action Points, Bonus Action Points and Movement Speed.
Cheat: Attack Rolls Always Critical Success
Attack Rolls always roll as a Critical Success.
Cheat: Attack Rolls Never Critical Fail
Attack Rolls never roll as a Critical Failure.
The drow inscription on this blade appears to have been recently carved. It translates to: 'Though I have to leave you, I will dance forever in Eilistraee's light.'
This character has been cleaned of blood and dirt.
This character will be automatically washed as if they had used soap at the end of combat.
The sheen of sussur sap forged into this sickle glows blue, silencing every creature it cuts.
Smoke-like whorls of sussur sap darken the metal of this dagger's blade and silence its victims.
Sussur roots extend from this sword's hilt into the blade itself. It yearns to drink magic, silencing every creature it strikes.
Adds enough experience points when consumed to reach max level.
Something - or some things - wriggle within the sticky shell.
Summons Runepowder Bombs at the target location. You are responsible for what happens if you use this.
Every ounce of Ironhand Gnome ingenuity has been poured into this metal casing - a moment of all-devouring destruction eagerly waiting release.
Those affected by this aura do not require a corpse to raise the dead.
Necrotic energy surrounds you and nearby allies. Those affected by this aura do not require a corpse to raise the dead.
Necrotic energy surrounds you and nearby allies. Those affected by this aura do not require a corpse to raise the dead.
Restores all Spell Slots to the caster.
Focus your mind to read the thoughts of certain creatures while talking to them.
Teleport yourself and up to 1 adjacent ally to an unoccupied space.
This potion buzzes with untapped potential. It's almost inspiring.
Gain resistance to all sources of damage.
Give the target resistances to all sources of damage.
Give the target resistances to al sources of damage.
You must wait before summoning the Unreleased Item Box again.

Summons a chest with a collection of unreleased items. These items are provided as they are in the game files and may or may not break things. Use at your own risk.
Chest will be destroyed after 5 rounds. Enable Turn-Based Mode and grab what you need.
A common chest of timber and iron.

A tyrant's grip must be one of cool, unforgiving, and intricately realised steel. It cannot budge, cannot falter, no matter the pressure, and its fingertips must deeply pierce those who would struggle against it.

The Lord of Murder wasn't always a lord. He was once just a petty killer. When Bhaal first drew blood in a Baldurian back-alley, it dropped to the ground and lingered. When he ascended, this dried blood-drop grew, warped - and became sharp.
This exquisitely-crafted chest, ornamented with gems and lined with cushioned velvet, is fit for storing the finest treasures.
You must wait before summoning the Common Equipment Box again.

Summons a chest with most Common Weapons and Armor.
Chest will be destroyed after 5 rounds. Enable Turn-Based Mode and grab what you need.
A placid smile and cherubic cheeks. Who knows what face once lay beneath.
Soft, unintelligible whispers seep from the dark wood, ringing in your ears and resounding in your skull.
Strike an enemy with lightning and then cause the target to explode. Six more bolts will leap from the target, electrifying and exploding as many as six other enemies within [1].
Strike an enemy with lightning. Three more bolts will leap from the target, electrifying as many as three other enemies within [1].
Shoot a bright flame from your fingers that explodes upon contact, torching everything in the vicinity.
Sturdy enough to endure rocky voyages or decades stacked ten-deep in a dusty warehouse.
A durable bag of thick canvas and leather, adorned with numerous straps and heavy buckles.
Small compartments line the sack: a compass-sized furrow; a pocket packed with storing salts; and an area for stiff tent legs, fixing pegs, and folded canvas.
Increase the approval rating of the target by 25.
<LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">Paralyse</LSTag> up to [2] creature. They cannot move, act or react. Attacks from within [1] are always Critical Hits.
<LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HOLD_PERSON">Hold</LSTag> a humanoid enemy still. They can't move, act or react. Attacks from within [1] are always <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hits</LSTag>.
Affected entity is <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">Paralysed</LSTag>. Attacks made against it within [1] are always <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hits</LSTag>.

Affected entity can't move or take actions, bonus actions, or reactions.

Attacks against the entity are always Critical Hits if the attacker is within [1].
This selection of face-paints transform the applicant into a vibrant clown, as if by magic.
Contrary to popular belief, your standard djinni doesn't grant wishes, unless that wish is to have your nose lopped off.
This exquisitely-crafted chest, ornamented with gems and lined with cushioned velvet, is fit for storing the finest treasures.
Activate this to decrease your Charisma stat by 1.
Activate this to decrease your Constitution stat by 1.
Activate this to decrease your Dexterity stat by 1.
Activate this to decrease your Intelligence stat by 1.
Activate this to decrease your Strength stat by 1.
Activate this to decrease your Wisdom stat by 1.
Activate this to increase your Charisma stat by 1.
Activate this to increase your Constitution stat by 1.
Activate this to increase your Dexterity stat by 1.
Activate this to increase your Intelligence stat by 1.
Activate this to increase your Strength stat by 1.
Activate this to increase your Wisdom stat by 1.
Activate this to reset your Charisma stat back to it's base value.
Activate this to reset your Constitution stat back to it's base value.
Activate this to reset your Dexterity stat back to it's base value.
Activate this to reset your Intelligence stat back to it's base value.
Activate this to reset your Strength stat back to it's base value.
Activate this to reset your Wisdom stat back to it's base value.
Ability Scores can be increased up to a maximum value of 30. If your base Ability Score is less than 10, the maximum value decrease by up to -2.
Ability Scores can be increased up to a maximum value of 30. If your base Ability Score is less than 10, the maximum value decrease by up to -2.
Ability Scores can be increased up to a maximum value of 30. If your base Ability Score is less than 10, the maximum value decrease by up to -2.
Ability Scores can be increased up to a maximum value of 30. If your base Ability Score is less than 10, the maximum value decrease by up to -2.
Ability Scores can be increased up to a maximum value of 30. If your base Ability Score is less than 10, the maximum value decrease by up to -2.
Ability Scores can be increased up to a maximum value of 30. If your base Ability Score is less than 10, the maximum value decrease by up to -2.
Ability Scores can be decreased to a minimum value of 0.
Ability Scores can be decreased to a minimum value of 0.
Ability Scores can be decreased to a minimum value of 0.
Ability Scores can be decreased to a minimum value of 0.
Ability Scores can be decreased to a minimum value of 0.
Ability Scores can be decreased to a minimum value of 0.
Cheat Respec: Do you wish to respec?
Opens the Cheaters Ring Change Log book.
This book contains the Cheatrs Ring mod change log. Read this to see what has been added, removed or changed.
The targets approval has been increased by 25!

WARNING! Teleporting between acts may break your game. Use at your own risk.
Unlocks all waypoints in Act 1.

WARNING! Teleporting between acts may break your game. Use at your own risk.
Unlocks all waypoints in Act 2.

WARNING! Teleporting between acts may break your game. Use at your own risk.
Unlocks all waypoints in Act 3.
This is a Spell Item. You can add to your hotbar or radial action menu.
A small pouch containing Spell Item versions of every spell from Cheaters Ring. You can add these anywhere to your hotbar or raidal action menu.
This is a Spell Item. You can add to your hotbar or radial action menu.
This is a Spell Item. You can add to your hotbar or radial action menu.

Toggle Cheat: Remove Passives in the passives tab on the Hotbar/Wheel menu to remove this effect.

While you have this effect, you will have access to all of the Cheaters Spell Scroll Passives.
Toggle Cheat: Remove Passives in the passives tab on the Hotbar/Radial menu to remove this effect.
This is a Spell Item. You can add to your hotbar or radial action menu.

Toggle this on to remove the effects of the Cheaters: Unlock Passives spell.
This will remove the abilitiy to use the passives from the Cheaters Spell Scroll.

This is a Spell Item. You can add to your hotbar or radial action menu.
A collection of cheat spells and passives. These spell items can be added to your hotbar or radial action menu.
Engulf targets in a area with flame-like radiance.
Hurl a mote of fire at the target. Upon impact with an enemy, launch 6 more Fire Bolts that lock on to nearby enemies dealing [1] them.
This is a Spell Item. You can add to your hotbar or radial action menu.
Nullify magic in a 30m radius for everyone except allies and party members.
This is a Spell Item. You can add to your hotbar or radial action menu.
A nearby character is draining this character of its magical energy, preventing it from casting spells.
A silver amulet depicting the symbol of Bhaal.
Summon an extra copy of the Cheaters Spell Scroll.
This is a Spell Item. You can add to your hotbar or radial action menu.
You are set as Invulnerable. Enemies will still attack you and you will be unaffected by Status Effects, this includes positive ones.
You have immunity to all damage types. Enemies will not attack you and positive Status Effects will still affect you.

Which version of God Mode do you want?

Type 1: Uses Invulnerable(). Enemies will still attack you but positive Status Effects such as Invisibility will not affect you.

Type 2: Uses Resistance(DamageType, Immune). Enemies will not attack you, but positive Status Effects such as Invisibility will affect you.

Always Critical Fail on Ability Checks, Skill Checks, and Saving Throws.
May not work 100% of the time. Nothing I can do about this. Disabling Karmic DIce in Options -> Gameplay may give more consistent results.

Always Critical Fail on Ability Checks, Skill Checks, and Saving Throws.

May not work 100% of the time. Nothing I can do about this. Disabling Karmic Dice in Options -> Gameplay may give more consistent results.
Cheat: Ability Checks Always Critical Fail
Ability Checks always roll as a Critical Failure.
Cheat: Skill Checks Always Critical Fail
Skill Checks always roll as a Critical Failure.
Cheat: Saving Throws Always Critical Fail
Saving Throws always roll as a Critical Failure.
Cheat: Dice Roll Negative Bonus Toggle
Adds a -40 to all Dice Rolls.
Adds a -40 to all Dice Rolls.
Increase nearby allies <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> by [1].
This is a Spell Item. You can add to your hotbar or radial action menu.
Throw a creature or object up to [1] with a thought.
This is a Spell Item. You can add to your hotbar or radial action menu.
While you have the ring equipped you have access to all of the Cheaters Spell Scroll passives. These passives can be found in the Passives Tab on the hotbar or in the radial menu.

While this is enabled, you will have access to all of the toggleable passives from the Cheaters Spell Scroll mod.
These passives are all disabled by default and must be enabled in the Passives Tab on the hotbar or radial menu.
This string is not used yet.
Shoot [2] magical darts, each dealing [1]. They always hit their target.
This is a Spell Item. You can add to your hotbar or radial action menu.
Your attacks deal an additional [1], but you take [2] every turn.
Affected entity deals an additional [1] with its attacks, but also receives [2] per turn.
Charge forward, pushing all objects and creatures in your path [1] away from you.
You must be <LSTag Tooltip="Concentration">concentrating</LSTag> on another spell to cast this. If the target was concentrating, you heal as much as the damage that was dealt to it.
The spell you were concentrating on, will end.
Sacrifice half your remaining <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag> to heal a target for the same amount.
Your targets have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and take [1] each time they miss.
You take [1] when you miss an attack.

Overwhelmed with a fear of failure.

The affected entity has Disadvantage on Attack Rolls and takes damage each time they miss an Attack Roll.

Removed upon succeeding an Attack Roll.

Affected entity has been granted temporary hit points by an illithid. If these are removed by incoming damage, the shield bursts, possibly <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STUNNED">Stunning</LSTag> nearby foes.
Conjure a volatile shield around yourself or an ally, granting the target [1].
If these temporary hit points are lost due to incoming damage, the shield bursts, possibly <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STUNNED">Stunning</LSTag> nearby foes.
You regain [1] each time one of your <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> hits, but you are <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to all damage.
Affected entity is <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to all damage, but when it attacks it heals [1].
Invest a creature with power that heals it when it attacks, but also makes it <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to all damage.
Invade a target's mind and disrupt its defences. The target's <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> is reduced by [1].
If the target dies while its psyche is fractured, you can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_TAD_Imperil_Recast">Shatter Psyche</LSTag> on another target.

Toggle this on to remove the effects of the Unlock Illithid Passives spell.

Allows the target to use most of the Illithid Passives from the Tadpole Power menu. Using these while already having the vanilla version unlocked through the Tadpole Power Menu may lead to unintended side effects or may cause other issues.
Toggle Cheat: Remove Illithid Passives in the passives tab on the Hotbar/Radial menu to remove this effect.

While you have this effect, you will have access to most of the Illithid Passives from the Tadpole Power menu. Using these while already having the vanilla version unlocked through the Tadpole Power Menu may lead to unintended side effects or may cause other issues.

The first <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRolls">Attack Roll</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag> you make against any target gains a bonus equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>.
This is a Spell Item. You can add to your hotbar or radial action menu.

Toggle this on to unlock the Favourable Beginnings Passive.

The first Attack Roll or Ability Check you make against any target gains a bonus equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

Toggle this on to unlock the Ability Drain Passive.

Once per turn, when you make an Attack Roll, the attack reduces that target's corresponding Ability by [1]. The reduced ability score cannot be decreased lower than 1.

Toggle this on to unlock the Charm Passive.

Channel the dark allure of the tadpole to Charm an enemy that attacks you, preventing them from attacking you until their next turn.

Toggle this on to unlock the Displace Passive.

Creatures suffering Falling damage because of your actions take an additional [1].

Toggle this on to unlock the Psionic Backlash Passive.

Using this while already having the vanilla version of Psionic Backlash unlocked from the Tadpole Power Menu may have unintended side effects and may lead to issues.

Toggle this on to unlock the Illithid Expertise Passive.

You have deepened your sense of self, gaining Expertise in Persuasion, Deception, and Intimidation Checks.

Toggle this on to unlock the Psionic Dominance Passive.

When an enemy within [1] targets you with a spell of a Level that is lower than or equal to your Proficiency Bonus, you can use your reaction to nullify the spell.

Toggle this on to unlock the Freecast Passive.

You have discovered a marvellous adaptability within yourself. Spell slots, charges, and similar resource costs for your next action or spell are removed. Refreshes after a Long Rest.
Cheaters Luck of the Far Realms

Toggle this on to unlock the Luck of the Far Realms Passive.

When you land a Critical Hit or kill a target with a melee weapon attack, you can make another melee weapon attack as a bonus action that turn.

Attacks with melee weapons you are Proficient with, and are wielding in both hands, can deal an additional 10 damage at the cost of a -5 Attack Roll penalty. (You can toggle this on and off.)

Your Strength increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You gain 3 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="LuckPoint">Luck Points</LSTag>, which you can use to gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>, or to make an enemy reroll their Attack Rolls.
Use to add or remove this Passive Feature. This will not remove the version unlocked through the Level Up menu.

When a creature casts a spell within melee range of you, you have Advantage on any Saving Throw against it, and you can use a reaction to immediately make an attack against the caster.

Enemies you hit have Disadvantage on Concentration Saving Throws.
Use to add or remove this Passive Feature. This will not remove the version unlocked through the Level Up menu.

When you wear Medium Armour, it doesn't impose <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on Stealth <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag>. The bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> you can gain from your Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> also becomes +3 instead of +2.
Use to add or remove this Passive Feature. This will not remove the version unlocked through the Level Up menu.

Your movement speed increases, and difficult terrain doesn't slow you down when you Dash.

If you move after making a melee attack, you don't provoke Opportunity Attacks from your target.
Use to add or remove this Passive Feature. This will not remove the version unlocked through the Level Up menu.

You gain <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourProficiency">Armour Proficiency</LSTag> with Medium Armour and shields, and your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Use to add or remove this Passive Feature. This will not remove the version unlocked through the Level Up menu.

Use to add or remove this Passive Feature. This will not remove the version unlocked through the Level Up menu.

You can also make an Opportunity Attack when a target comes within range.
Use to add or remove this Passive Feature. This will not remove the version unlocked through the Level Up menu.

When making melee weapon attacks, you roll your damage dice twice and use the highest result.
Use to add or remove this Passive Feature. This will not remove the version unlocked through the Level Up menu.

When an enemy within melee range attacks an ally, you can use a reaction to make a weapon attack against that enemy. Target ally must not have the Sentinel Feat.

You gain Advantage on Opportunity Attacks, and when you hit a creature with an Opportunity Attack, it can no longer move for the rest of its turn.
Use to add or remove this Passive Feature. This will not remove the version unlocked through the Level Up menu.

Your ranged weapon attacks do not receive penalties from High Ground Rules.

Ranged weapon attacks with weapons you are Proficient with have a -5 penalty to their Attack Roll, but deal an additional 10 damage. (You can toggle this on or off.)
Use to add or remove this Passive Feature. This will not remove the version unlocked through the Level Up menu.

You gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> while wielding a shield. If a spell forces you to make a Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, you can use a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">reaction</LSTag> to shield yourself and diminish the effect's damage. On a failed Saving Throw, you only take half damage. On a successful Saving Throw, you don't take any damage.
Use to add or remove this Passive Feature. This will not remove the version unlocked through the Level Up menu.

When you make an unarmed attack, use an improvised weapon, or throw something, your Strength <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> is added twice to the damage and <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>.
Use to add or remove this Passive Feature. This will not remove the version unlocked through the Level Up menu.
Your hit point maximum increases by 2 for every level you have gained.
Use to add or remove this Passive Feature. This will not remove the version unlocked through the Level Up menu.

Use to add or remove this Passive Feature. This will not remove the version unlocked through the Level Up menu.
